annotations: MALLORIE HOGAN, BSN, RN, MSN, FNP-BC

Professional Goal: Utilize my years of nursing experience in the clinical setting as a Nurse Practitioner by joining a dynamic team that provides empathetic and compassionate care to patients to better serve the community.
Education:
University of California, Davis, Sacramento, CA
MSN, Family Nurse Practitioner June 2021
University of Portland, Portland, OSR
Bachelor of Science in Nursing May 2015
Experience:
Eskaton Village Carmichael- Carmichael, CA September 2016- present
Charge RN- Skilled Nursing Facility
Administer medications (PO, IM, IV, etc), perform treatments and procedures as prescribed in a timely and efficient manner
Coordinate resident care between disciplines, call Doctor or family as ordered to update on resident’s status
Demonstrate knowledge of rehabilitative and preventative aspects of care and ensures resident safety, comfort and protection
Supervise and direct care given to residents by LVN’s and CNA’s
Document each resident’s assessment, plan of care and communicate to Doctor any vitals, labs or behavior that
are unstable or out of range
Employee of the month: July 2017, Guardian Angel
Caretaker for 90-year-old May 2015-present
Ambulate around block with assistive device
Prepare meals, clean house, bathe, administer medications, catheter care
Transport to and from appointments
Michael’s Arts and Crafts Store-Portland, OR transfer to CA September 2013-September 2017
Cashier/ Sales Floor Associate
Answer phone calls and communicate with co-workers over radio
Ask customer about their project and help them find merchandise throughout the store
Resolve customer complaints by listening to complaint and calling my manager if necessary
Offer customer assistance, put away unwanted merchandise on the floor and answer stock check calls
Employee of the Month: October 2015, April 2016, August 2016
University of California, Davis- Sacramento, CA June 2015-October 2015
Volunteer- Emergency Department
Address patient’s comfort needs every two hours
Relay information about a patient’s status to family members after consulting with the nurse
Retrieve lab results; reports from radiology; pick up supplies from Central Supply, Distribution and Pharmacy
Transport lab specimens and blood from blood bank in a timely manner
Assist staff with transporting, cleaning and/or escorting patients around ED with nurse’s consent
Restock supplies such as: bedside carts, IV carts, linen and property bags, blanket warmers and wheelchairs/gurneys
University of Portland- Portland, OR July 2013
Summer Nursing Immersion Program Mentor
Led group of first year students on campus wide scavenger hunt to orient them to facilities
Organized meet and greet activities to facilitate connections among participants
Instructed students on simulated lab activities
Kaiser Permanente- Sacramento, CA May 2010-August 2013
Volunteer
Promoted to Trainer/ Leader and was responsible for training two to three volunteers weekly
Volunteered on several units including: Ambassador, Radiology, ICU, surgery waiting room and PACU
Certifications:
ACLS June 2024
CPR/BLS November 2022
California RN license: 950823 September 2023
California NP license: 95018019
NP Furnishing license: 95018019
